content.description: Climb the right side of the black water streak.  A little trickery, and the crux, lies at the start of the bulge.
content.location: 5th route from the left.  Climbs the right side of the black water streak.

content.description:
The gem of the cliff- this route tackles the steep white face on the part of the cliff that faces the road. Start up a technical and interesting vertical face to a good rest, brace yourself, then tackle the headwall above. The crux comes soon, but the sustained nature may send more than a few for a ride towards the top.

Note: The 5th clip is a bit tough to hang the draw on, so be prepared.
content.location: The 8th route, third route outside the gully. Look for the new bolts going up the white face with a clearing below.

content.description: Wander through some steeper territory on holds that aren't as good as you would like.

One of the better routes on the cliff according to the new guidebook, I found it to be a one-move wonder kind of route that will probably feel easier the more traffic it gets- the crux is mostly trying to find the holds on this one.
content.location: In the gully, second route on the right.

content.description: Climbing on big jugs the whole way. Crux is a little traverse at the start of the bulge.
content.location: 6th route from the left.  Goes straight up to the bulge and then trends left through some big cobbles.

content.description:
If you like Pump Action Hero the neighbor to the right is essentially the easier version.

Start with smaller holds that give way to gradually easier climbing up the vertical to slightly overhung terrain.
content.location: Just to the right of Pump Action Hero

content.description: A decent warm-up for the crag if you're planning on attempting the two 5.11s here.
content.location: Third route on the right in the gully.

content.description: Climb the left side of the black streak.  Big holds the whole way.  A nice, straightforward climb.
content.location: 4th route from the left.  Climbs the left side of the black streak.

content.protection: 6 bolts.  Shares the anchors with "Not Made In China"
content.location: Furthest route up Viper Tongue Canyon as you are hiking in

content.description: Seems likely that some holds are missing since the FA.  Pull up to a big jug at the first bolt and get established.  Good luck making it to the second.  Have a good belay here or you might end up decking.  The guidebook calls it 10b but the start is a monster; weigh in with what you think.
content.location: Furthest R route on the wall.  Is separated and on its own.
